Package javax.jaxtx.compensation

Interface Summary
CompensationParticipant This is the interface that participants within a compensation transaction must support.
CompensationParticipantManager When a Compensation Transaction participant registers with a transaction it may get a reference to a service that lets it callback into the transaction and drive any state-transitions for itself.
CompensationTransaction This is the interface that the transaction service implementation exposes in order to allow compensation participants to be enrolled.
CompensationTransactionManager This is the interface that container uses to demarcate transactions.
Status This enumeration class represents the states that a compensation transaction and participants may be in.
UserCompensationTransaction This is the interface that allows Compensation transactions (CTs) to be started and terminated.
 

Exception Summary
AlreadyRegisteredException Thrown if the participant has already been registered with the compensation transaction.
CompensationTransactionCancelledException Thrown if the compensation transaction cancelled when it was asked to confirm.
NoCompensationTransactionException Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the target object/thread.
NotRegisteredException Thrown if the participant has not been registered with the compensation transaction and an attempt is made to unregister it.
NotSupportedException Thrown if the implementation does not support nested compensation transactions.
SystemException Thrown if an error occurs which is not met by another specific exception.
UnknownCompensationTransactionException Thrown if the system does not know about the transaction that is associated with the operation being performed, or if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
UnknownParticipantException Thrown if the system does not know about the participant.
WrongStateException Thrown if the state of the transaction service is not correct for the operation being performed.
